column4: I can't install new Applications, what's wrong with my computer?
give us more information. WHY can't you install new applications?
i just get [program name here] cannot be installed on your computer type (i386). Either the application requires special hardware features or the vendor decided to not support your computer type.
and that's for EVERY application
how are you trying to install applications? thru synaptic? command line apt-get? what?
The Applications > Add/Remove app
have you tried using synaptic instead? just to see if it works
Where's that?
system > administration > synaptic package manager
there you just have to search for the name of the application you want, check it and then 'apply'
Nope, no results
is it a fresh install? was it working before?
installed yesterday, only started trying today
is that an ordinary pc or does it have any weird setup/configuration?
Well it's a dual boot system, if that makes and difference.
and what version of ubuntu are you running?
Fixed!!
awesome =D that's great news
thanks for the help :D
you're welcome =D it's good that you came back to tell us everything is ok now
;P
Thanks again
